result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:47 PM Defendant Holly Ruth Thayer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Holly Ruth Thayer. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Gill acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:12 PM Defendant Holly Ruth Thayer appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Holly Ruth Thayer. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (22CF105, 22CF125) and recites appearances. Atty Gill makes statement, requests breakout room with DEF.  

OFF THE RECORD / 1:13PM - Atty Gill and DEF in breakout room.

BACK ON THE RECORD /  1:20PM - Appearances remain unchanged.  Atty Gill indicates DEF would like to waive preliminary hearing in both cases.  DEF agrees with waiver.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived her right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. 

OFF THE RECORD / 1:23PM -  for scheduling Court sets ARGN for 6/7/22 at 2:30PM.
Arraignment scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:43 AM Defendant Holly Ruth Thayer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.  Attny Gill request preliminary hearing to be set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Violated bond 22CF105.

CASH BOND RETURNED FROM JAIL MARKED REFUSED AS DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN BOND.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Narcotics.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

State makes bond recommendation, makes note of 22CF105.  Atty Thomas-Schmidt argues bond.  Court sets bond.  Court sets initial appearance for 5/10/22 at 8:30AM.
